name: 'Narnia': Part II Quiz / Test | The Chronicles of Narnia | 10 Questions

questions.text: When we left off in the previous quiz, Lucy had just returned from her first visit to Narnia.  Excitedly, she tells her siblings about her incredible discovery.  Unfortunately, only Edmund believes her, while the older children, Peter and Susan, do not.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Edmund pretends to support Lucy's story, but then turns on her rather maliciously.  In the book he is even worse, taunting her about finding 'new countries in wardrobes'.  Edmund will soon have a slight attitude adjustment, however.

questions.text: Edmund is the second child to venture into the magical world of Narnia, having followed Lucy during her second excursion into the wardrobe.  Not being able to find Lucy, he explores the frigid woods of Narnia alone until he encounters a great sledge, pulled by reindeer.  What is the name of the spooky little dwarf who drives the sledge?
questions.explanation:
Ginarrbrik.

	Ginarrbrik is played by actor/stuntman Kiran Shah, who has previously appeared in such films as 'Legend', 'Return of the Jedi' and 'Raiders of the Lost Ark'.

questions.text: The sole passenger on the sledge is a beautiful but fearsome looking woman with an extremely pale complexion.  She claims to be the Queen of Narnia, but we will soon know of her as the White Witch.  Which very excellent actress portrays this utterly wicked character?
questions.explanation:
Tilda Swinton.

	Tilda Swinton is a veteran actress who has appeared in such films as 'Constantine', 'Adaptation' and 'Vanilla Sky'.   The White Witch claims to be queen, but in the books she is revealed to be a false claimant to the throne, something that helps legitimize her eventual fate.

questions.text: We know that she is the White Witch, and that she claims to be the Queen of Narnia, but what is the real name of this icy figure?
questions.explanation:
Jadis.

	Jadis's name is revealed on the note left at Mr. Tumnus's place by her secret police.  Without revealing anything too substantial, I will just say that Jadis is not human, though she has made claims to the contrary.

questions.text: The White Witch is extremely curious about this boy she has discovered, and immediately proceeds to question young Edmund.  In order to make Edmund more malleable to her queries, she bribes him with hot cocoa and which delicious confection?
questions.explanation:
Turkish Delight.

	Edmund specifically requests Turkish Delight, and the White Witch conjures it up with a drop of her magical potion.  As he greedily eats, he admits that he is human, that his sister Lucy has already entered Narnia and made friends with Mr. Tumnus and that the two of them have two more older siblings.  The White Witch claims not to have any children of her own, and says that she will make Edmund her heir, but only if he is able to retreive his siblings (who will become his servants). Turkish Delight (or lokum) is a gelatinous confection, usually fruit flavored, that is dusted with sugar.

questions.text: Edmund and Lucy return together from this brief sojourn into Narnia.  Unfortunately, when Lucy again attempts to convince Peter and Susan that Narnia exists, Edmund cruelly refuses to corroborate her story.  The older children later inquire with Old Professor Kirke about Lucy's wardrobe story.  Does the Professor believe her claims?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	After Lucy claims that she and Edmund have just returned from Narnia, Peter and Susan turn to Edmund, who suggests, 'You know what little children are like today, they don't know when to stop pretending.' Professor Kirke is in support of Lucy's story, and encourages the two older siblings to keep an open mind.

questions.text: Just prior to the first mutual entrance of the four siblings into Narnia, they are playing a game together on the grounds outside the mansion.  What game is this that they play?
questions.explanation:
Cricket.

	Having somewhat forgotten about their Narnian adventures, the children have settled into a regular routine.  They play cricket on a sunny day, but the halcyon atmosphere is broken, as is a window, when Edmund takes a powerful swing at the cricket ball.  The children soon find themselves in trouble and running from Mrs. MacReady, and they find that their only alternative is to enter the wardrobe to hide.

questions.text: 'Impossible!', says Susan as she takes her first look at Narnia.  Peter is equally startled upon his emergence into this mystical, new world.  It doesn't take long for the children to have a bit of fun in this wonderland.  What winter-related activity do they engage in soon after entering Narnia from the 'real' world?
questions.explanation:
Snowball fight.

	Despite Peter's annoyance at Edmund for having lied about Narnia, the elder boy is not averse to enjoying himself.  He playfully lobs snowballs at his youngest sister Lucy, who has naughtily begun the fray.  Soon, the children are convinced to head towards Mr. Tumnus's home by the urgings of little Lucy.

questions.text: When the children arrive back at Mr. Tumnus's place, they find that the home has been ransacked.  A note has been left by the chief of the White Witch's secret police.  What is the name of this frightening beast?
questions.explanation:
Maugrim.

	Maugrim is voiced by actor Sim Evan-Jones.  The note left by Maugrim states that Mr. Tumnus has been charged with high treason by the White Witch.  He has been taken to her ice palace for sentence.

questions.text: Distraught, the children wonder whether they should return to the wardrobe or continue on in Narnia.  Lucy insists that they stay, feeling responsible for Mr. Tumnus's fate.  Their fate is also soon sealed when they suddenly encounter which type of animal, who beseeches them to follow?
questions.explanation:
Beaver.

	The animated Mr. Beaver is voiced by actor Ray Winstone, who you may recognize from films such as 'Cold Mountain', 'Sexy Beast' and 'King Arthur'.   I hope you have enjoyed this quiz.  Please feel free to join me in the next installment!
